page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The main industry is arable farming. The A15 road runs through the area from north to south.To the east of the A15 is Fen land.The land rises to the west, the highest point being Swallow Hill.The centre of population is in Thurlby and Northorpe,population 1450,which to a visitor would appear as one village.St Firmins Church standing on the bank of Car Dyke is the oldest building in the area.This is on the east of the A15.The main housing development is on the west of the A15.Very few people are employed within the farming industry.Thurlby and Northorpe since the 1960's have developed as a residential area for the surrounding district.Employment is found in Bourne,Stamford and Spalding, but the majority of people travel to Peterborough,16miles to the south.Some even travel to London by train.
